info.title: Floatplane REST API
info.description:
Homepage: [https://jman012.github.io/FloatplaneAPIDocs](https://jman012.github.io/FloatplaneAPIDocs)

This document describes the REST API layer of [https://www.floatplane.com](https://www.floatplane.com), a content creation and video streaming website created by Floatplane Media Inc. and Linus Media Group, where users can support their favorite creates via paid subscriptions in order to watch their video and livestream content in higher quality and other perks.

While this document contains stubs for all of the Floatplane APIs for this version, many are not filled out because they are related only to content creation, moderation, or administration and are not needed for regular use. These have "TODO" as the description, and are automatically removed before document generation. If you are viewing the "Trimmed" version of this document, they have been removed for brevity.

## API Object Organization

- **Users** and **Creators** exist on Floatplane at the highest level
	- The highest-level object in Floatplane is the Creator. This is an entity, such as Linus Tech Tips, that produces media for Users.
- A Creator owns one or more **Subscription Plans**
- A User can view a Creator's Content if they are subscribed to them
- A Creator publishes **Content**, in the form of **Blog Posts**
	- Content is produced by Creators, and show up for subscribed Users to view when it is released. A piece of Content is meant to be generic, and may contain different types of sub-Content. Currently, the only type is a Blog Post.
	- A Blog Post is the main type of Content that a Creator produces. Blog Posts are how a Creator can share text and/or media attachments with their subscribers.
- A Blog Post is comprised of one or more of: video, audio, picture, or gallery **Attachments**
	- A media Attachment may be: video, audio, picture, gallery. Attachments are a part of Blog Posts, and are in a particular order.
- A Creator may also have a single **Livestream**

## API Flow

As of Floatplane version 3.5.1, these are the recommended endpoints to use for normal operations.

1. Login
	1. `/api/v3/auth/captcha/info` - Get captcha information
	1. `/api/v2/auth/login` - Login with username, password, and optional captcha token
	1. `/api/v2/auth/checkFor2faLogin` - Optionally provide 2FA token to complete login
	1. `/api/v2/auth/logout` - Logout at a later point in time
1. Home page
	1. `/api/v3/user/subscriptions` - Get the user's active subscriptions
	1. `/api/v3/content/creator/list` - Using the subscriptions, show a home page with content from all subscriptions
		1. Supply all creator identifiers from the subscriptions
		1. This should be paginated
	1. `/api/v2/creator/info` - Also show a list of creators that the user can select
		1. Note that this can search and return multiple creators. The V3 version only works for a single creator at a time.
1. Creator page
	1. `/api/v3/creator/info` - Get more details for the creator to display, including if livestreams are available
	1. `/api/v3/content/creator` - Show recent content by the creator
	1. `/api/v2/plan/info` - Show available plans the user can subscribe to for the creator
1. Content page
	1. `/api/v3/content/post` - Show more detailed information about a piece of content, including text description, available attachments, metadata, interactions, etc.
	1. `/api/v3/content/related` - List some related content for the user to watch next
	1. `/api/v3/comment` - Load comments for the content for the user to read
		1. There are several more comment APIs to post, like, dislike, etc.
	1. `/api/v2/user/ban/status` - Determine if the user is banned from this creator
	1. `/api/v3/content/{video|audio|picture|gallery}` - Load the attached media for the post. This is usually video, but audio, pictures, and galleries are also available.
	1. `/api/v2/cdn/delivery` - For video and audio, this is required to get the information to stream or download the content in media players
1. Livestream
	1. `/api/v2/cdn/delivery` - Using the type "livestream" to load the livestream media in a media player
	1. `wss://chat.floatplane.com/sails.io/?...` - To connect to the livestream chat over websocket. TODO: Map out the WebSocket API.
1. User Profile
	1. `/api/v3/user/self` - Display username, name, email, and profile pictures

## API Organization

The organization of APIs into categories in this document are reflected from the internal organization of the Floatplane website bundled code, from `frontend.floatplane.com/{version}/vendor.js`. This is in order to use the best organization from the original developers' point of view.

For instance, Floatplane's authentication endpoints are organized into `Auth.v2.login(...)`, `Auth.v2.logout()`, and `Auth.v3.getCaptchaInfo()`. A limitation in OpenAPI is the lack of nested tagging/structure, so this document splits `Auth` into `AuthV2` and `AuthV3` to emulate the nested structure.

## Notes

Note that the Floatplane API does support the use of [ETags](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/ETag) for retrieving some information, such as retrieving information about creators, users, etc. Expect an HTTP 304 if the content has not changed, and to re-use cached responses. This is useful to ease the strain on Floatplane's API server.

The date-time format used by Floatplane API is not standard ISO 8601 format. The dates/times given by Floatplane include milliseconds. Depending on your code generator, you may need to override the date-time format to something similar to `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`, for both encoding and decoding.

tags.name: AuthV2
tags.description: Sign up, login, 2FA, and logout. Additionally, login spoofing for administrators.

tags.name: CDNV2
tags.description: Content Delivery mechanisms for Floatplane media.

tags.name: ConnectedAccountsV2
tags.description: 3rd party account management, such as Discord or LTT Forums.

tags.name: CreatorV2
tags.description: Get and discover creators on the platform. Creator invitation and profile management.

tags.name: CreatorV3
tags.description: Get and discover creators on the platform. Creator invitation and profile management.

captchaToken.description: The Google Recaptcha v2/v3 token to verify the request. On web browsers, this is required. For mobile or TV applications, this is not required only if the User-Agent indicates so (e.g., if the User-Agent contains "CFNetwork" in its value). Otherwise, the application would have to supply a valid captcha token, which can be difficult to obtain dynamically in some scenarios.

needs2FA.description: If true, the user has not yet been authenticated, and will need to submit the 2FA token to complete authentication.

token.description: The two-factor authentication token that the user inputs to complete the login process.

cdn.description: The domain of the CDN server to use.

uri.description: The path to attach to the `cdn` property above. Replace the items surrounded by curly braces (`{`, `}`) with the appropriate values from the `data` property, depending on chosen resolution. First, choose the `qualityLevel`, then use the given token from the `qualityLevelParam` for that `qualityLevel`'s `name`.

items.description: Represents a quality of video to download

name.description: Used to identify this level of quality, and to refer to the `qualityLevelParams` object below by the property key.

width.description: The video quality's resolution's width in pixels.

height.description: The video quality resolution's height in pixels.

order.description: The display order to be shown to the user.

subscriptions.description: The subscriptions this invoice is in reference to.

totalSubscriberCount.description: The total number of subscribers for this creator.

totalIncome.description: The total amount of monthly income for this creator. This field tends to always be $0 for regular users.

discordRoles.description: The available roles for the associated Discord servers that are available with this plan.

blogPost.description: The GUID of the blogPost the comment should be posted to.

text.description: The text of the comment being posted.

comment.description: The GUID of the comment being liked.

blogPost.description: The GUID of the post the comment is on.

lastElements.description: Information about paging: what the last ID retrieve is and if more posts can be retrieved afterward for subsequent requests.

blogPostId.description: This may be `null` if no blog posts for this creator appeared yet on this page of blog posts.

text.description:
Text description of the post. May have HTML paragraph (`

`) tags surrounding it, along with other HTML..

url.description: The URL the user has configured for this link.

name.description: The code name of this link type.

displayName.description: The display-friendly name of this link type.

hostName.description: The hostname that should be a part of the URL.

property.description: Use `contentEmail` for email notifications, and `contentFirebase` for push notifications.

text.description:
Text description of the post. May have HTML paragraph (`

`) tags surrounding it, along with other HTML..

UserModel.description: Represents some basic information of a user (id, username, and profile image).

key.description: Unique identifier for the account type.

enabled.description: Determines if the system allows this account to be connected to.

connected.description: If true, the user is connected and the `connectedAccount` will have data about the account.

answer.description: This field may contain HTML that should be rendered.

CookieAuth.name: sails.sid
CookieAuth.description:
Authentication and authorization to Floatplane API calls is governed by the `sails.sid` HTTP Cookie. To obtain this cookie, you must authenticate to `/api/v2/auth/login`.

When dealing with cookies in native applications (not via a website inside of a browser), please keep in mind that some languages/libraries may keep cookies across requests by default, and some may not. For instance, in Swift the `URLSession.shared` object with default configuration will automatically track and persist cookies across requests.

400BadRequest.description: Bad Request - The request has errors and the server did not process it.

401Unauthenticated.description: Unauthenticated - The request was not authenticated to make the request.

errors.name: notLoggedInError
errors.message: You must be logged-in to access this resource.

example.message: You must be logged-in to access this resource.

403Forbidden.description: Forbidden - The request was not authenticated to make the request.

errors.name: missingAchievementError
errors.message: You lack one or more of the required achievements needed to access the requested resource.

example.message: You lack one or more of the required achievements needed to access the requested resource.

404NotFound.description: Not Found - The resource was not found.

post.description: Login to Floatplane with the provided username and password, retrieving the authentication/authorization cookie from the response for subsequent requests.

200.description: OK - Returns the header and information about the logged-in user, including the id, username, and profile image.

Set-Cookie.description: Contains the cookie used in subsequent authenticated requests.

twoFactorLogin.description: If `$request.needs2FA == true`, then to complete the login process, you will need to submit the user's inputted two-factor token to this endpoint.

getSubscriptions.description: Upon successful login, the usual next step is to retrieve the current subscriptions for the user.

401.description: Unauthenticated - The login attempt failed, either due to a bad username or password.

post.description: Log out of Floatplane, invalidating the authentication/authorization cookie.

Set-Cookie.description: Obtain a new authentication/authorization cookie after logging out. This new cookie will not be authenticated to perform subsequent requests.

post.description: Complete the login process if a two-factor authentication token is required from the beginning of the login process.

200.description: OK - Returns the header and information about the logged-in user, including the id, username, and profile image.

Set-Cookie.description: Contains the cookie used in subsequent authenticated requests.

getSubscriptions.description: Upon successful login, the usual next step is to retrieve the current subscriptions for the user.

401.description: Unauthenticated - The login attempt failed, either due to a bad username or password.

get.description: Gets the site keys used for Google Recaptcha V2 and V3. These are useful when providing a captcha token when logging in or signing up.

login.description: After retrieving the recaptcha site keys and generating a validated token through recaptcha, the tokens can be used in the login process.

get.description: Given an video/audio attachment identifier, retrieves the information necessary to play, download, or livestream the video/audio at various quality levels.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Used to determine which kind of retrieval method is requested for the video.

- VOD = stream a Video On Demand
- AOD = stream Audio On Demand
- Live = Livestream the content
- Download = Download the content for the user to play later.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: The GUID of the attachment for a post, retrievable from the `videoAttachments` or `audioAttachments` object. Required when `type` is `vod`, `aod`, or `download`. Note: either this or `creator` must be supplied.

parameters.name: creator
parameters.description: The GUID of the creator for a livestream, retrievable from `CreatorModelV2.id`. Required when `type` is `live`. Note: either this or `guid` must be supplied.

200.description: OK - Information on how to stream or download the requested video from the CDN in various levels of quality.

get.description: List the available 3rd party accounts for the user's profile.

200.description: OK - Returns the list of connected and available accounts.

get.description: Retrieve detailed information on one or more creators on Floatplane.

parameters.name: creatorGUID
parameters.description: The GUID identifer(s) of the creator(s) to be retrieved.

200.description: OK - The creators are found from their identifiers and returned in an array

subscriptionPlans.title: LTT Supporter (1080p)
subscriptionPlans.description:
Includes:
- Early access (when possible)
- Live Streaming
- Behind-the-scenes, cutting room floor & exclusives

NOTE: Tech Quickie and TechLinked are included for now, but will move to their own Floatplane pages in the future

subscriptionPlans.title: LTT Supporter Plus
subscriptionPlans.description:
You are the real MVP. 

Your support helps us continue to build out our team, drive up production values, run experiments that might lose money for a long time (*cough* LTX *cough*) and otherwise be the best content creators we can be.

This tier includes all the perks of the previous ones, but at floatplane's glorious high bitrate 4K!

get.description: Retrieve and search for all creators on Floatplane. Useful for creator discovery and filtering.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Optional search string for finding particular creators on the platform.

example.title: TechDeals
example.description: Welcome to Tech Deals on Floatplane!  Having nothing to do with actual floatplanes since 2016, we are proud to be part of the launch of Floatplane!  We make videos about technology!
example.about: Welcome to Tech Deals on Floatplane!  Having nothing to do with actual floatplanes since 2016, we are proud to be part of the launch of Floatplane!  We make videos about technology!

liveStream.title: CES 2020 - Bonus Coverage for Floatplane Subs
liveStream.description: Welcome to the Tech Deals stream  this should be fun!

offline.title: We're offline at the moment. Please check back later!
offline.description: We're offline at the moment. Please check back later!

subscriptionPlans.title: 1080p Plan - Videos on Demand + Live Streams
subscriptionPlans.description: This plan gives you access to all published videos at up to 1080p detail.  You also get access to 1080p live streams exclusive to Floatplane.  This also grants you access to the private channels on the Tech Deals Discord, link your Floatplane account to Discord to be automatically upgraded.

subscriptionPlans.title: 4K - All Access Plan
subscriptionPlans.description: This plan gives you access to all published videos at up to 4K detail.  You also get access to 1080p live streams exclusive to Floatplane.  This also grants you access to the private channels on the Tech Deals Discord, link your Floatplane account to Discord to be automatically upgraded.  BONUS - This plan allows you to download the videos in high quality for off-line viewing!  This is a great way to increase your level of support if you really love our content!

example.title: EposVox
example.description:
The ORIGINAL content creator and streaming focused tech education channel. EposVox, the Stream Professor, is here to give you how to videos, tutorials, tips and tricks, as well as gear reviews and benchmarks to get the most out of your tech experience. 
While content creation and streaming (especially with software like OBS Studio and XSplit) are primary focuses of content, ultimately the goal is to make technology easier and more fun to use. Education is number one, entertainment is sometimes given.
The analog tech nostalgia is just inherent to being a 90s kid.

 Shipping: 
P.O. Box 459 
Jeffersonville, IN 47131

subscriptionPlans.title: FLOATPLANE FLOATBOATS (1080p)
subscriptionPlans.description:
Primary Floatplane sub. Help me build the best tech education platform on the internet and keep diving into crazy nerdy details no one else covers. This tier gets you all of the currently-available video playback, downloads and live streaming.  BTS Vlogs & Early Access, too! All up to 1080p quality.
Videos will be given as early access as much as a month (though usually just a week) before YouTube, when available.

subscriptionPlans.title: Super Sub (4k)
subscriptionPlans.description: You get... EVERYTHING! Future features will expand here, but for now, you get everything already available, and this is just here for those who want to support a little more :)

get.description: Retrieve a list of FAQ sections to display to the user. Each section contains one or more FAQ items. This is normally accessible from https://www.floatplane.com/support. Note that the answers to the FAQs will contain HTML.

faqs.question: How do you get the PewPew emote?
faqs.answer: The PewPew emote was as an account reward for users who had succesfully set up a payment method on Floatplane.com before January 1st 2019.

faqs.question: Can you upgrade me to the LTT supporter (1080p) subscription?
faqs.answer: At this time there is no difference between the two channels in regards to features that are unlocked. The only difference between the two is the price.

example.name: Subscription and Payment
example.description: Life isn't always about money but this section is. If you have a payment or subscription issue look here.

get.description: Retrieve a list of saved payment methods for the user's account. Payment methods are how the user can pay for their subscription to creators on the platform.
Retrieve a list of billing addresses saved to the user's account, to be used in conjunction with a payment method when purchasing subscriptions to creators.
Retrieve a list of paid or unpaid subscription invoices for the user.
Retrieve a list of all active subscriptions for the user.

getContent.description: With the subscribed creator identifiers, the next step is to usually load the home page by loading content from all of the subscribed creators. Note that while the JSON Pointer in this definition only retrieves the first creator identifier, all can be used for `getMultiCreatorBlogPosts`.

getCreators.description: With the subscribed creator identifiers, another operation is to get more information about the creators to show to the user to select, as opposed to a combined home page. Note that while the JSON Pointer in this definition only retrieves the first creator identifier, all can be used for `getMultiCreatorBlogPosts`.

get.description: Retrieve more detailed information about one or more users from their identifiers.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The GUID identifer(s) of the user(s) to be retrieved.

200.description: OK - Results of the user search

get.description: Retrieve more detailed information about one or more users from their usernames.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username(s) of the user(s) to be retrieved.

200.description: OK - Results of the user search

get.description: Retrieve information about the current security configuration for the user.
Determine whether or not the user is banned for a given creator.

parameters.name: creator
parameters.description: The GUID of the creator being queried.

200.description: OK - Whether the user is banned or not

get.description: Retrieve recent activity for a user, such as comments and other interactions they have made on posts for creators.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The GUID of the user being queried.

activity.comment: This is the text of the comment being posted

get.description: Retrieve configured social media links from a user's profile.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The GUID of the user being searched.

get.description: Retrieve more detailed information about the user, including their name and email.
Retrieve notification details for a user. The details are split into seperate settings for each subscribed creator.

post.description: Enable or disable email or push notifications for a specific creator.

200.description: OK - Whether or not the update was successful

post.description: Post a new comment to a blog post object.

example.text: This is the text of the comment being posted

200.description: OK - Commented posted successfully, returning comment details

example.text: This is the text of the comment being posted

get.description: Get comments for a blog post object. Note that replies to each comment tend to be limited to 3. The extra replies can be retrieved via `getCommentReplies`. The difference in `$response.body#/0/totalReplies` and `$response.body#/0/replies`'s length can determine if more comments need to be loaded.

parameters.name: blogPost
parameters.description: Which blog post to retrieve comments for.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of comments to return. This should be set to 20 by default.

parameters.name: fetchAfter
parameters.description: When loading more comments on a blog post, this is used to determine which which comments to skip. This is a GUID of the last comment from the previous call to `getComments`.

200.description: OK - All comments returned for the query parameters

example.text: This is my comment text, I really like this video.

getMoreComments.description: Load more comments, using the identifier of the last comment to determine the new comments to get.

getMoreReplies.description: Some comments have more replies than are returned in `getComments`. Use `getCommentReplies` to load more replies to a certain comment.

get.description: Retrieve more replies from a comment.

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: The identifer of the comment from which to retrieve replies.

parameters.name: blogPost
parameters.description: The identifer of the blog post the `comment` belongs to.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: How many replies to retrieve.

parameters.name: rid
parameters.description: The identifer of the last reply in the reply chain.

post.description: Like a comment on a blog post.
Dislike a comment on a blog post.

get.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of blog posts from a creator. Or search for blog posts from a creator.

Example query: https://www.floatplane.com/api/v3/content/creator?id=59f94c0bdd241b70349eb72b&search=illegal&tags[0]=battery

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The GUID of the creator to retrieve posts from.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of posts to return.

parameters.name: fetchAfter
parameters.description: The number of posts to skip. Usually a multiple of `limit`, to get the next "page" of results.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search filter to look for specific posts.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: An array of tags to search against, possibly in addition to `search`.

subscriptionPlans.description:
You are the real MVP. 

Your support helps us continue to build out our team, drive up production values, run experiments that might lose money for a long time (*cough* LTX *cough*) and otherwise be the best content creators we can be.

This tier includes all the perks of the previous ones, but at floatplane's glorious high bitrate 4K!

getBlogPost.description: A user can select a post from the list in this operation to view it in more detail.

get.description:
Retrieve paginated blog posts from multiple creators for the home page.

Example query: https://www.floatplane.com/api/v3/content/creator/list?ids[0]=59f94c0bdd241b70349eb72b&limit=20&fetchAfter[0][creatorId]=59f94c0bdd241b70349eb72b&fetchAfter[0][blogPostId]=B4WsyLnybS&fetchAfter[0][moreFetchable]=true

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The GUID(s) of the creator(s) to retrieve posts from.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of posts to retrieve.

parameters.name: fetchAfter
parameters.description: For pagination, this is used to determine which posts to skip. There should be one `fetchAfter` object for each creator in `ids`. The `moreFetchable` in the request, and all of the data, comes from the `ContentCreatorListV3Response`.

example.title: TL: Facebook Does Not Care.
example.text:
NEWS SOURCES:

MICRO-BOSS, WORD

Microsoft to make its devices more repairable following pressure

https://linustechtips.com/topic/1379452-microsoft-agrees-to-independent-third-party-study-to-look-into-right-to-repair/

https://grist.org/accountability/bowing-to-investors-microsoft-will-make-its-devices-easier-to-fix/

https://www.asyousow.org/about-us#:~:text=As%20You%20Sow%20is%20the%20nation%E2%80%99s%20non-profit%20leader%20in%20shareholder%20advocacy.

Louis is happy https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TiMdvR99fBQ

WHAT, THIS OLED THING?

Switch OLED launches https://arstechnica.com/gaming/2021/10/switch-oled-review-nintendos-nicest-most-nonessential-upgrade-yet/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4mHq6Y7JSmg

New Joy-Cons, but drift isnt going away

https://www.polygon.com/22688586/nintendo-switch-oled-joy-con-drift-controllers

screen protector https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2021/10/switch-oled-comes-with-a-screen-protector-installed-but-please-dont-remove-it-says-nintendo

SHAMEBOOK

Facebook has more outages

https://www.engadget.com/facebook-and-instagram-are-down-for-the-second-time-this-week-193257623.html

https://twitter.com/Facebook/status/1446556732977778695

IG fixed https://twitter.com/InstagramComms/status/1446582114468597761

Unfollow everything developer banned https://www.theverge.com/2021/10/8/22716044/facebook-unfollow-everything-tool-louis-barclay-banned-for-life

https://slate.com/technology/2021/10/facebook-unfollow-everything-cease-desist.html

https://louisbarclay.notion.site/Unfollow-Everything-cease-and-desist-letter-from-Facebook-ea219169421b457bb7ce010b7bf9ce1f

QUICK BITS

GET JEFFD

Game backgrounds on Twitch replaced with Jeff Bezos

https://twitter.com/AnEternalEnigma/status/1446421951883489281

defaced https://www.cnet.com/tech/gaming/twitch-reportedly-defaced-with-pictures-of-jeff-bezos/

ABOUT TO GET PADDLED

First In-App Purchasing alternative for iOS: Paddle

https://twitter.com/PaddleHQ/status/1446050078301605890

https://paddle.com/platform/in-app-purchase/

Sweeney

https://twitter.com/TimSweeneyEpic/status/1446117510919585796

STAY KINECTED

Sky Glass TV looks like a big iMac

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GpGskL5PCKU

Kinect motion controls https://www.theverge.com/2021/10/7/22714117/microsoft-kinect-is-back-sky-glass-tv-smart-camera-features - full screen embedded video on this page and record


UPGRADED TO CUMULONIMBUS

XCloud is now running Xbox Series X hardware

https://www.kitguru.net/gaming/matthew-wilson/microsoft-has-upgraded-xcloud-to-xbox-series-x-hardware/

https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2021-10-07-xbox-cloud-gaming-now-runs-on-series-x-hardware

NO PIXEL LEFT UN-LEAKED

Pixel 6 and 6 Pro teardowns leaked

https://9to5google.com/2021/10/08/pixel-6-pro-teardown-leak/

get.description: Retrieve more information on a video attachment from a blog post in order to consume the video content.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the video attachment object, from the `BlogPostModelV3`.

get.description: Retrieve more information on a picture attachment from a blog post in order to consume the picture content.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the picture attachment object, from the `BlogPostModelV3`.

post.description: Toggles the like status on a piece of content. If disliked before, it will turn into a like. If liked before, the like will be removed.
Toggles the dislike status on a piece of content. If liked before, it will turn into a dislike. If disliked before, the dislike will be removed.
Retrieve a list of loyalty rewards for the user. The reason for why this is a POST and not a GET is unknown.
